frameDefinitions: A Speaker uses language to affirm or deny the truth of a Message to some Addressee.
An Agent or Cause makes a New_member part of  Group.
A Speaker declares that they will no longer be involved with the Content.
A Cognizer has a relatively fixed positive or negative point of view towards an Issue.
A Speaker addresses a Proposal made by an Interlocutor, either agreeing to it or rejecting it.
A Speaker either agrees to or refuses to engage in a Proposed_action, proposed by an Interlocutor. ''
frameExamples: She <t>affirmed</t> her loyalty to the cause.
I <t>added</t> a new rock to my collection.
That will only be possible if and when the IRA <t>renounces</t> armed struggle.
In interviews , it seems like everyone is completely <t>against</t> this expenditure .
They were <t>rebuffed</t> again in the larger city of Provo. CNI
They <t>agreed</t> to express their outrage with editorials in today's paper.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity affirming or denying the truth of the <fen>Message</fen> (this can be spoken or written). It is normally expressed as the External Argument of the predicative uses of the target word, or as the Genitive modifier of the noun.
The <fen>Message</fen> identifies the content whose truth the <fen>Speaker</fen> is affirming or denying. It can be expressed as a clause or as a noun phrase.
The <fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to transmit the <fen>Message</fen>.

The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Message</fen> pertains. It is rarely mentioned in constructions with verbal targets, and is much more common with nominal targets, where it is usually expressed as a PP Complement headed by 'of' or about'.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Message</fen> is affirmed or denied.
<fen>Place</fen> specifies the location where the <fen>Message</fen> is affirmed or denied.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is a volitional animate being who causes the <fen>New_member</fen> to become part of the <fen>Group</fen>.
Something that is already a member of the <fen>Group</fen> and represents the <fen>Group</fen> as a whole.
An item that becomes a part of the <fen>Group</fen>.

The <fen>Group</fen> is anything that can be conceptualized as a complex collection of parts or ingredients, including through metonymy like containers or locations, which <fen>New_member</fen>s can join.
An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that is responsible for causing a <fen>New_member</fen> to enter a <fen>Group</fen>.
This role identifies when the inclusion of the <fen>New_member</fen> to the <fen>Group</fen> occurs.
The location in which a <fen>New_member</fen> is entered into a pre-existing <fen>Group</fen>.
The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the person who communicates their cessation of association with the <fen>Content</fen>.
The idea that the <fen>Speaker</fen> no longer associates with, whether it be an activity, a propostion, or a group.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to transmit the statement of renunciation.
The time when the statement is made.
The role specifies the place where the statement takes place.
The individual that holds an opinion on an <fen>Issue</fen> or Side.
The matter, usually concerning a course of action, which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has a positive or negative opinion about.
The party or individual (generally associated with a particular position on an <fen>Issue</fen>) that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has an opinion about.
An action taken by a <fen>Side</fen> or a view that the <fen>Side</fen> takes on an issue which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> either supports or opposes.
The time period during which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has the indicated point of view towards the <fen>Issue</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Cognizer</fen> takes <fen>Side</fen>s on an <fen>Issue</fen> .
The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the person who communicates the reply or response.

This is the person who made the <fen>Proposal</fen> to the <fen>Speaker</fen> and to whom the <fen>Speaker</fen> communicates  their response. This frame element stands in for the <fen>Proposal</fen> and is only licensed when the <fen>Proposal</fen>  can be understood from the context.
The <fen>Proposal</fen> is the prior communication or action to which a response is given.
The time interval during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes their verbal response.
The location in which the <fen>Speaker</fen>  makes a verbal response.
The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the person to whom a particular action has been proposed and who responds to the request or offer made.
This is the person who proposed the <fen>Proposed_action</fen>  to the <fen>Speaker</fen> and to whom the <fen>Speaker</fen> communicates  their response.
The <fen>Proposed_action</fen> is an action that the <fen>Speaker</fen> would perform if they were to accept or refuse the request or offer.
The time interval during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes their verbal response concerning the proposed action.
The location in which the <fen>Speaker</fen>  gives their verbal response to the proposed action.
listRoleExamples: No one believed <fex>Evelyn</fex>'s affirmation that she could speak to ghosts.
They refute the criticisms <fex>that they are only interested in power and money</fex>.
<fex>Matt</fex> seems to add new work to his flickr most days.
The companyincludes philanthropic endeavors in their accomplishments
<fex>The calls of crows</fex> added an eerie aspect to the atmosphere of our date.
Bonnie Charlie then renounced <fex>his aspirations to the throne</fex>.
Castro renounced all involvement with the group <fex>over the radio</fex>.
<fex>Last year</fex> she opposed the bill, but changed her mind after she received correspondence supporting the bill.
<fex>Iran</fex> on Saturday rejected Europe's proposal for ending the standoff over Tehran's nuclear program.

But senior SLN officials had rebuffed <fex>the man who is ever so willing to please
the guerrillas</fex>.
Dr. Carolyn Herrington has accepted <fex>our offer to become Dean of the College of Education</fex> .
This must make <fex>yesterday's</fex> Taliban rebuff all the more wounding.
Legislation that would have required smaller school districts to share administrators has been rebuffed repeatedly <fex>in the Oklahoma House of Representatives</fex>.

passageCandidateSpans.text: Fourteenth Amendment precedent of congressional determination '

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Comment, Rescinding Ratification of Proposed Constitutional Amendments
A Question for the Court, 37 La. L. Rev. 896
Rees, Throwing Away the Key: The Unconstitutionality of the Equal Rights Amendment Extension, 58 Tex. L. Rev. 875
Tribe, A Constitution We Are Amending: In Defense of a Restrained Judicial Role, 97 Harv. L. Rev. 433
The Legitimacy of Constitutional Change: Rethinking the Amendment Process, 97 Harv. L. Rev. 386
